title: Mob Justice Is Trampling Democratic Discourse (by Anne Applebaum, The Atlantic)
text: “I think people’s tolerance for discomfort — people’s tolerance for dissonance, for not hearing exactly what they want to hear — has now gone down to zero,” one person told me. “Discomfort used to be a term of praise about pedagogy — I mean, the greatest discomforter of all was Socrates.” The interaction between the angry mob and the illiberal bureaucracy engenders a thirst for blood, for sacrifices to be offered to the pious and unforgiving gods of outrage.
